A fun game the is even more fun with friends. Both CooP and Objective modes are rewarding and the perk systems, while tedious, gives you a reason to keep playing your favorite class. On normal, missions can be beaten very easily with little cooperation, but "Hell on Earth" requires a very strong and coordinated team!

The downside of this game is the weapon pack purchases. While the default weapons in the shop are more than enough to make you a useful team memeber, any purchasable DLC that impacts gameplay is bad DLC. Buy the game, but not the DLC weapon packs.

With KF2 on the "horizon," I would not think before you purchase this game.

Killing Floor grew from amateur modification of Unreal Tournament 2004. Therefore to speak about loan of ideas at Left 4 Dead it isn't necessary – founders of game developed the concept of the command zombie shooter. Last year they addressed in Tripwire Interactive studio with the offer to include their creation in quality fashion in Red Orchestra shooter: Ostfront 41-45. However the management of the company considered Killing Floor rather perspective for transformation into independent game. But personally game didn't impress me. (This my opinion and it can not coincide with yours).

Killing Floor - кооперативный шутер от первого лица расчитанный на 6 человек. Вроде бы самая обычная игра за 10$, но затянет она вас очень и очень надолго. Тут тебе, и разнообразные монстры, и куча оружия, и slow motion, и прокачка классов, много взрывов, карты, каждая со своей историей и атмосферой.
Особенно хотелось бы отметить фишку с завареванием дверей, очень интересная идея, которая здесь реализованна на 5+
Казалось бы все прекрасно, но у игры тоже есть свои минусы:
- Однообразный геймплей, неделями задротить не получится так как бысто надоест, но очень приятно будет через недельку другую вернутся в родную kf.
- Отсутвие интерактивности, как ни крути UE3 это вам не Frostbite 3, да и бюджет совсем другой, единственное с чем можно взаимодействовать это двери и стекла, но это уже скорее придирки.

Игру я однозначно рекомендую, весело играть как одному так и с друзьями, моя оценка игре 9/10. Если вы её ещё не купили, не жалейте денег игра отработает их на 150%

Killing Floor is up there on the "famous Steam games" list. Possibly everyone who's been on Steam for at least a year knows about it. The main reason might be that Killing Floor runs PERFECTLY. Personally, my old computer was a distant cousin to the toaster, and it ran flawlessly. With a better computer I can set the game to max settings and not have a single frame skip. In terms of gameplay, you could even state that it's one of the most solid FPS's out there. Even though the game itself is simple, being just a simple horde mode, it feels right. I guess the few words to summarize KF is that it just FEELS RIGHT.

Good for killing time and your wallet (Dear god the DLC.). Killing Floor offers a good amount of challenge and a large amount of monsters to keep you coming back for a good long time. I usually a wouldn't reccomend a game like this but the community is still very much active and Tripwire continues to keep this game alive and well to my surprise. The controls and weaponry are tight and responsive and are further improved by strong sound and level design. Though the tech behind it is nothing to beat an eye an eye at the asthetics are surprisngly strong and manage to give the game a unique sort of texture if you will. It's 3D models have the sort of charm the old PS1 horror games had but smoother. The atmosphere is either dark, tense and brooding or light hearted and silly. Grab it while you can lads!

By far, the best sequel to Resident Evil ever. It even has Samuel L. Jackson in it. Character development is terrible though because there's only one voice actor for the entire cast (except the one character who has a vagina). 
But by far, the worst sequel to Tekken. There isn't even any fighting mechanics. 
Overall, would not recommend to my cat. Would recommend to my parrot.

Released in 2009 with UT2004 Engine, Killing floor is a must have for those who are searching for challenge in cooperation games : I say hard, and I mean it ! Play in NORMAL mode, it will be a walk of health for experimented players. Push it a bit to HARD, then you will start to feel the deepness and importance of teamwork ! And when you get to the end in hard, no worries, you still have SUICIDAL, and HELL ON EARTH mode to push your teamwork to the limits.

Chose one of the 6 perks : Sharpshooter, Commando, Medic, Firebug, Support, and for thoses who wanna play like men, demolition. Then survive the 11 waves. Weld some doors to hold your spot, heal your allies, and a deal a good ammout of damage per second to reach the last wave !

Concerning graphics, ok they are still from the UT2004 engine, but actually every machine can play it on maximum graphics, and I have to say it's more than correct !

After 800 hours of gaming on Killing Floor, it's still hard to get every achievment and to finish every map in HOE mode. So it will take some time before you get pissed of it !

So COME ON and join us on this great meat festival.
I highly recommand this game to the people who find modern First Person Shooters too easy.

Для меня в таких играх важным аспектом является какая-нибудь цель, например прокачиваться или повышаться. Эта игра как раз таки даёт такую возможность, причём на прокачку каждого навыка придётся потратить довольно большое количество времени. Хоть игра довольно простая, но затягивающая и интересная. Игра расчитана на командное выживание и лучше играть с друзьями, ибо некоторые незнакомые люди, с которыми ты играешь на сервере могут вообще не обращать на вас никакого внимания. Вообщем игра для меня просто прекрасна, но есть то, что её дико портит. Это, конечно, DLC. Премиум скины по 150 руб. и парочка оружий за 200 руб. не стоят своих денег. Причём многие паки с оружиями абсолютно ничем не отличаются от своих аналогов. Ни уроном, ни скорстрельностью, ни перезарядкой, только окраской, и тратить на это деньги я не вижу смысла. А так игра заслуженно получает оценку 8/10
Delicia de jogo
Great game, zombies and chainsaws, plus some cool zombies get this game

What makes Killing Floor special in terms of gameplay is that fact that it's not linear like other co-op survival games. You are not forced to go through specific areas of the map to beat the game, but to kill all the specimens that come in waves. After you do that you get to fight a boss, Patriarch.

One of the first things you notice while playing is that the game does not have a crosshair, which in my opinion makes it more realistic and challenging. It's not a big deal since anyone can get used to it pretty quick. There are also 7 different perks that give bonus stats to specific weapons. The higher the perk level, the more bonuses you get (weapon damage, spawn with better guns etc.). You don't have to necessarily play with one perk the whole game. Every time a wave is over you can change your perk, which is also a good thing.

The maps look also pretty detailed and have the right atmosphere to fit in. There's also some metal-ish music playing in the background to keep you pumped. However, you may want to mute the music  since sometimes you really need to be able to hear strong enemies coming from behind, like fleshpounds.

So, why do I not recommend the game?

Though there are many mods by the community and a lot of great ideas, TWI ignored most of them and released bunch of DLC instead. The earlier ones are mostly cosmetic, but advertising them in the  menu all the time is unacceptable for a game that I have actually paid. Later they even decided to add weapon DLC, that one wasn't cosmetic. Now, I'm not saying that it's pay-to-win since the game is co-op. However guns in killing floor matter and affect the gameplay. When there is a community that has bunch of decent ideas or concepts for your game and you ignore them and release DLC, that's dirty. But I thought " Alright, I got 200 hours on this game so I guess I got my money's worth". Ironically they added some of the community's ideas to "early access" Killing Floor 2 and presented it as "new content", just to make the players feel like they're getting something. 

Some people had high hopes for KF2 but sadly the second one is much worse since they added microtransactions while it's on 'early access' state.

I have owned Killing Floor since around the time it was originally released.
It has [b]never[/b] let me down.

Player wise - you will come across a BOATLOAD of idiots that seriously want to bring down your gameplay experience; especially on servers that are not altered (those with more than 6 slots and serverside perks, as well as friendlyfire servers). You cannot compare the Killing Floor community to something like the Counter-Strike: Source community - they are both very different, and Killing Floor, while being a co-op game, still for some reason makes everyone think it is every man for themself.

The DLC that came out the first few times is well worth the purchase, so are the Golden Weapons. However I do not think the camo reskins are worth the money. That is my only negative factor about it; the DLC just went downhill.

There are holidays events going on all the time. Hillbilly Horror, Twisted Christmas, etc. The models of the "specimens", as they are called (not just "zombies"!), are remodeled for the holidays with counterparts respective to the festivity. Some server owners also set their servers to play on the holiday maps more frequently.

A very big two thumbs up.

Killing floor is a team survival horror game. The graphics may be sub-par, but the guns feel great, the gore is fine, the enemies are a real challenge (on medium difficulty or higher), and to top it off... there are classes. This game is great with friends or without, but without a  doubt is right up there with left for dead.
